title: How to Check Word Count in Word: Easy Guide for Windows, Mac, & Mobile

steps.title: Open a document in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open a document in Microsoft Word. By default, you should see the word count in the status bar near the bottom of any open document. If you don't see it, proceed to the next step. You should be able to see the Word count on the status bar on both Windows and Mac computers.

steps.title: Right-click the status bar.
steps.content: Right-click the status bar. If you don't see the word count, right-click or control-click the status bar at the bottom of the document. You'll also see the number of pages, page layout, and zoom options in this status bar. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Select Word Count.
steps.content: Select Word Count . This should now have a check next to it. You can now see the word count in the status bar. For more details, such as Paragraphs, Lines, Characters, and more, you can click Word Count in the status bar.

steps.title: Open a document in Word.
steps.content: Open a document in Word. To open a document, go to the File menu, and then click on Open . Select the document you want to open. By default, Microsoft Word automatically counts the number of pages and words for you. You can usually find this towards the bottom of the window. However, if you don't see this, proceed to the next steps to find this option.

steps.title: Click the Tools menu.
steps.content: Click the Tools menu. Once your document is open, select the Tools menu at the top center of the screen.

steps.title: Select Word Count.
steps.content: Select Word Count . You'll find this in the Tools menu.

steps.title: Review your word count.
steps.content: Review your word count. A box will open displaying the number of words, as well as the number of characters, paragraphs, lines, and pages, contained in your document. In many documents, the word count is displayed live on the left side of the bottom bar of the document window. Click on this word count to get additional information, such as the number of pages and characters.

steps.title: Place your cursor at the beginning of the text you wish to count.
steps.content: Place your cursor at the beginning of the text you wish to count. Click on the beginning of the sentence, paragraph, or section of text for which you want a word count.

steps.title: Highlight the section of text.
steps.content: Highlight the section of text. Click and drag your cursor to the end of the text section, which should now be highlighted in blue. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: View the word count in the status bar.
steps.content: View the word count in the status bar. You can find this at the bottom-left corner. If you don't see this option, right-click or control-click the status bar and select Word Count . On Mac, you can click Tools in the top-menu, and then select Word Count .

steps.title: Open a document in Word on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open a document in Word on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. The app will usually open the last document you were working on. If not, you will see a list of recently opened files. Tap on the file you wish to work on.

steps.title: Tap the Edit menu.
steps.content: Tap the Edit menu. Once your document is open, tap on the Edit menu (a capital "A" with a pencil icon) in the top center of your screen. The Edit menu will open in the bottom half of your screen. In Word for iPad, tap on the Review menu at the top center of the tablet's screen.

steps.title: Tap on Home.
steps.content: Tap on Home . Home is located on the left side of the Edit menu bar. This will open a pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap on Review.
steps.content: Tap on Review . The Review menu is near the bottom of the Edit menu pop-up.

steps.title: Tap on Word Count.
steps.content: Tap on Word Count . Word Count is near the bottom of the Review menu. When you tap it, the number of words, characters, and pages in your document will be displayed. In Word for iPad, word count is an icon, several lines with the numbers "123" displayed in the upper left, in the main menu bar under the Review menu. Highlight a section of text by tapping on it with your fingers, then tap on Word Count to display the number of words in the highlighted portion of your document.

steps.title: Launch Word online.
steps.content: Launch Word online. Navigate to the Office website and log in with your Microsoft ID and password or choose to use the free version. These steps will work in the free version of Word on the web and the web version of Word 365.

steps.title: Open a document.
steps.content: Open a document. On the left side of your screen, select a recent document. If you don't see the document you want to edit, select Open from OneDrive or Open from Dropbox in the lower left corner of the window.

steps.title: Review the word count.
steps.content: Review the word count. Once you have an open document, check the bottom-left side of the document. The word count automatically appears in the lower scroll bar. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source
